rules.title: Validation rules for the TIFF Image File Directory Entry(IFD)
rules.description:
Each 12-byte IFD entry has the following format:
Bytes 0-1 The Tag that identifies the field. Bytes 2-3 The field Type. Bytes 4-7 The number of values, Count of the indicated Type. Bytes 8-11 The Value Offset, the file offset (in bytes) of the Value for the field.
The Value is expected to begin on a word boundary; the corresponding Value Offset will thus be an even number. This file offset may point anywhere in the file, even after the image data.

rule.title: invalid IFDE type
rule.description:
The field types and their sizes are:
1 = BYTE 8-bit unsigned integer. 2 = ASCII 8-bit byte that contains a 7-bit ASCII code; the last byte must be NUL (binary zero). 3 = SHORT 16-bit (2-byte) unsigned integer. 4 = LONG 32-bit (4-byte) unsigned integer. 5 = RATIONAL Two LONGs: the first represents the numerator of a fraction; the second, the denominator. 7 = UNDEFINED An 8-bit byte that may contain anything, depending on the definition of the field.
To store a complicated data structure in a private tag, use the UNDEFINED field type and set the Count to the number of bytes required to hold the data structure.
rule.assert: Invalid TIFF type, this type is not defined in the Baseline 6.0

rules.title: DocumentName
rules.description:
The name of the document from which this image was scanned.
Tag = 269 (10D.H) Type = ASCII No default

rule.title: DocumentName tag valid Type
rule.description: DocumentName Tag type must be ASCII
rule.assert: DocumentName Tag type is not valid, an ASCII type is expected

rules.title: PageName
rules.description:
The name of the page from which this image was scanned.
Tag = 285 (11D.H) Type = ASCII No default

rule.title: PageName tag valid Type
rule.description: PageName Tag type must be ASCII
rule.assert: PageName Tag type is not valid, an ASCII type is expected

rules.title: Site
rules.description:
Site name.
Tag = 34016 (84E0.H) Type = ASCII No default

rule.title: Site tag valid Type
rule.description: Site Tag type must be ASCII
rule.assert: Site Tag type is not valid, an ASCII type is expected

rules.title: IT8Header
rules.description:
Unmodified headers appended by ASCII “null” from ISO 10755, ISO 10756, and ISO 10759.
Tag = 34016 (84E2.H) Type = ASCII No default

rule.title: IT8Header tag valid Type
rule.description: IT8Header Tag type must be ASCII
rule.assert: IT8Header Tag type is not valid, an ASCII type is expected

rule.title: IT8Header obsolete
rule.description: The IT8Header field provides the ability to include unmodified headers (appended by an ASCII “null” at the end of the character string) from ISO 10755, ISO 10756, and ISO 10759 in the TIFF/IT files. TIFF/IT readers are not required to interpret and use the contents of the IT8Header field. The use of the IT8Header tag is only recommended for compatibility with readers based on the 1998 edition of this International Standard:ISO 12639-1998. International Standards ISO 10755, ISO 10756, and ISO 10759 are obsolete and have been withdrawn.
rule.assert: The use of the IT8Header tag is only recommended for compatibility with ISO 12639-1998. ISO 10755, ISO 10756, and ISO 10759 are obsolete.

rules.title: Orientation
rules.description:
The orientation of the image with respect to the rows and columns. Tag = 274 (112.H) Type = SHORT N = 1 Default is 1.
Basic orientations: 1 = The 0th row represents the visual top of the image, and the 0th column represents the visual left-hand side. 4 = The 0th row represents the visual bottom of the image, and the 0th column represents the visual left-hand side. 5 = The 0th row represents the visual left-hand side of the image, and the 0th column represents the visual top. 8 = The 0th row represents the visual left-hand side of the image, and the 0th column represents the visual bottom.
Optional orientations: 2 = The 0th row represents the visual top of the image, and the 0th column representsthe visual right-hand side. 3 = The 0th row represents the visual bottom of the image, and the 0th column representsthe visual right-hand side. 6 = The 0th row represents the visual right-hand side of the image, and the 0th column represents the visual top. 7 = The 0th row represents the visual right-hand side of the image, and the 0th columnrepresents the visual bottom.
Support for orientations other than 1 is not a Baseline TIFF requirement.

rule.title: Orientation recommended values
rule.description:
Orientation basic values are:
1 = The 0th row represents the visual top of the image, and the 0th column represents the visual left-hand side. 4 = The 0th row represents the visual bottom of the image, and the 0th column represents the visual left-hand side. 5 = The 0th row represents the visual left-hand side of the image, and the 0th column represents the visual top. 8 = The 0th row represents the visual left-hand side of the image, and the 0th column represents the visual bottom. Default is 1.
rule.assert: Orientation value is valid but not recommended, use a basic Orientation value instead

rules.title: XPosition
rules.description:
X position of the image. The X offset in ResolutionUnits of the left side of the image, with respect to the left side of the page.
Tag = 286 (11E.H) Type = RATIONAL N = 1 No default

rule.title: XPosition tag valid Type
rule.description: XPosition Tag type must be RATIONAL
rule.assert: XPosition Tag type is not valid, an RATIONAL type is expected

rule.title: XPosition valid cardinality
rule.description: The cardinality of the XPosition tag must greater than 0
rule.assert: XPosition cardinality is not valid, cardinality should be greater than 0

rule.title: XPosition invalid location
rule.description: XPosition should only be used within a FP file
rule.assert: XPosition should only be used within a FP file

rule.title: XPosition match YPosition
rule.description: The cardinality of the XPosition tag must match YPosition cardinality
rule.assert: XPosition cardinality is not valid, cardinality must match YPosition cardinality

rule.title: XPosition default value
rule.description: If the XPosition and YPosition fields are not included for a component, the component is assumed to be positioned at the top left corner of the page.
rule.assert: If the XPosition field is not included for a component, the component is assumed to be positioned at the top left corner of the page. value 1

rules.title: YPosition
rules.description:
Y position of the image. The Y offset in ResolutionUnits of the top of the image, with respect to the top of the page. In the TIFF coordinate scheme, the positive Y direction is down, so that YPosition is always positive.
Tag = 287 (11F.H) Type = RATIONAL N = 1 No default

rule.title: YPosition tag valid Type
rule.description: YPosition Tag type must be RATIONAL
rule.assert: YPosition Tag type is not valid, an RATIONAL type is expected

rule.title: YPosition valid cardinality
rule.description: The cardinality of the YPosition tag must greater than 0
rule.assert: YPosition cardinality is not valid, cardinality should be greater than 0

rule.title: YPosition invalid location
rule.description: YPosition should only be used within a FP file
rule.assert: YPosition should only be used within a FP file

rule.title: YPosition match XPosition
rule.description: The cardinality of the YPosition tag must match XPosition cardinality
rule.assert: YPosition cardinality is not valid, cardinality must match XPosition cardinality

rule.title: YPosition default value
rule.description: If the XPosition and YPosition fields are not included for a component, the component is assumed to be positioned at the top left corner of the page.
rule.assert: If the YPosition field is not included for a component, the component is assumed to be positioned at the top left corner of the page. value 1

rules.title: ResolutionUnit
rules.description:
The unit of measurement for XResolution and YResolution.
Tag = 296 (128.H) Type = SHORT N = 1 Default is 2.
Currently defined values are: 2 = Inch. 3 = Centimeter.

rule.title: ResolutionUnit without absolute units
rule.description: ResolutionUnit (field 296) for TIFF/IT, TIFF/IT-P1 and TIFF/IT-P2 conformity levels shall contain the value 3 to indicate centimetres or the value 2 (default value) to indicate inches. The other value for ResolutionUnit recognized by TIFF, but not by TIFF/IT, is 1, meaning no absolute unit of measurement is specified.
rule.assert: ResolutionUnit without absolute units, TIFF/IT do not support no absolute unit of measurement

rules.title: NewSubfileType
rules.description:
A general indication of the kind of data contained in this subfile. Replaces the old SubfileType field, due to limitations in the definition of that field. NewSubfileType is mainly useful when there are multiple subfiles in a single TIFF file. This field is made up of a set of 32 flag bits. Unused bits are expected to be 0. Bit 0 is the low-order bit.
Tag = 254 (FE.H) Type = LONG N = 1 Default is 0.
Currently defined values are: Bit 0 is 1 if the image is a reduced-resolution version of another image in this TIFF file; else the bit is 0. Bit 1 is 1 if the image is a single page of a multi-page image (see the PageNumber field description); else the bit is 0. Bit 2 is 1 if the image defines a transparency mask for another image in this TIFF file. The PhotometricInterpretation value must be 4, designating a transparency mask. Bit 3 is 1 if identify TIFF/IT-FP files.
These values are defined as bit flags because they are independent of each other.

rule.title: NewSubfileType valid value
rule.description: The value of the NewSubfileType tag must be between 0 and 16
rule.assert: NewSubfileType value is not valid,the value should be between 0 and 15

rules.title: Compression
rules.description:
Compression scheme used on the image data.
Tag = 259 (103.H) Type = SHORT N = 1 Default = 1
Currently defined values are: 1 = No compression 4 = CCITT G4-encoding scheme 7 = JPEG encoding scheme ('new-style' JPEG) 8 = Deflate ('Adobe-style') 32895 = the use of RasterPadding in the CT or MP format (IT8CTPAD) 32896 = the run-length encoding scheme for the LW format (IT8LW) 32897 = the run-length encoding scheme for the HC format (IT8MP) 32898 = the run-length encoding scheme for the BL format (T8BL)

rule.title: Valid Compression value
rule.description: The Compression tag must have a valid value. 1 = No compression 4 = CCITT G4-encoding scheme 7 = JPEG encoding scheme ('new-style' JPEG) 8 = Deflate ('Adobe-style') 32895 = the use of RasterPadding in the CT or MP format (IT8CTPAD) 32896 = the run-length encoding scheme for the LW format (IT8LW) 32897 = the run-length encoding scheme for the HC format (IT8MP) 32898 = the run-length encoding scheme for the BL format (T8BL)
rule.assert: The Compression tag must have a valid value

rules.title: PlanarConfiguration
rules.description:
How the components of each pixel are stored.
Tag = 284 (11C.H) Type = SHORT N = 1 Default is 1
Currently defined values are: 1 = pixel interleaved 2 = colour interleaved 32768 = line interleaved

rule.title: PlanarConfiguration valid values
rule.description: The values of the PlanarConfiguration tag must be 1(Chunky) or 2(Planar)
rule.assert: PlanarConfiguration value is not valid, valeu should be ust be 1(Chunky) or 2(Planar)

rules.title: RasterPadding
rules.description:
The RasterPadding field allows each line of colour or interleaved colours to be padded to a 1-, 2-, 4-, 512-, or 1 024-byte boundary.
Tag = 34019 (84E3.H) Type = SHORT N = 1 Value = VALUE (possible values listed below) Default 0
valid values are: 0 = byte raster (default value) pad to 1 byte 1 = word raster pad to 2 bytes 2 = long-word raster pad to 4 bytes 9 = sector raster pad to 512 bytes 10 = long sector raster pad to 1 024 bytes

rule.title: RasterPadding valid Type
rule.description: RasterPadding Tag type must be SHORT
rule.assert: RasterPadding type is not valid, an SHORT type is expected

rule.title: RasterPadding valid cardinality
rule.description: The cardinality of the RasterPadding tag must be 1

rule.title: RasterPadding valid values
rule.description: RasterPadding valid values are: 0 = byte raster (default value) pad to 1 byte 1 = word raster pad to 2 bytes 2 = long-word raster pad to 4 bytes 9 = sector raster pad to 512 bytes 10 = long sector raster pad to 1 024 bytes

rule.title: RasterPadding default value
rule.description: RasterPadding has a default value when it is not defined in a Colour continuous-tone pictures (CT) value 0 is assumed
rule.assert: RasterPadding has a default value when it is not defined in a Colour continuous-tone pictures (CT) value 0 is assumed

rule.title: RasterPadding default value
rule.description: RasterPadding has a default value when it is not defined in a Monochrome continuous-tone picture (MP) value 0 is assumed
rule.assert: RasterPadding has a default value when it is not defined in a Colour continuous-tone pictures (CT) value 0 is assumed

rule.title: RasterPadding only in CT and MP type
rule.description: RasterPadding should only be used in Colour continuous-tone pictures (CT)
rule.assert: RasterPadding should only be used in Colour continuous-tone pictures.

rules.title: BitsPerRunLength
rules.description:
Number of bits for short run length encoding.
Tag = 34020 (84E4.H) Type = SHORT N = 1 Default 8

rule.title: BitsPerRunLength valid Type
rule.description: BitsPerRunLength Tag type must be SHORT
rule.assert: BitsPerRunLength type is not valid, an SHORT type is expected

rule.title: BitsPerRunLength valid cardinality
rule.description: The cardinality of the BitsPerRunLength tag must be 1

rule.title: BitsPerRunLength valid only in LW file
rule.description: BitsPerRunLength should only be used in TIFF/IT-LW line-art files
rule.assert: BitsPerRunLength should only be used in TIFF/IT-LW line-art files

rule.title: BitsPerRunLength default value
rule.description: BitsPerRunLength has a default value. if it not present default value 8 is assumed
rule.assert: BitsPerRunLength has a default value. if it not present default value 8 is assumed

rules.title: BitsPerExtendedRunLength
rules.description:
Number of bits for long run length encoding.
Tag = 34021 (84E5.H) Type = SHORT N = 1 Default 16

rule.title: BitsPerExtendedRunLength valid Type
rule.description: BitsPerExtendedRunLength Tag type must be SHORT
rule.assert: BitsPerExtendedRunLength type is not valid, an SHORT type is expected

rule.title: BitsPerExtendedRunLength valid cardinality
rule.description: The cardinality of the BitsPerExtendedRunLength tag must be 1

rule.title: BitsPerExtendedRunLength valid only in LW file
rule.description: BitsPerExtendedRunLength should only be used in TIFF/IT-LW line-art files
rule.assert: BitsPerExtendedRunLength should only be used in TIFF/IT-LW line-art files

rule.title: BitsPerExtendedRunLength default value
rule.description: BitsPerExtendedRunLength has a default value. if it not present default value 8 is assumed
rule.assert: BitsPerExtendedRunLength has a default value. if it not present default value 8 is assumed

rules.title: HCUsage
rules.description:
HCUsage indicate the type of information contained in the HC file.
Tag = 34030 (84EE.H) Type = LONG N = 1 Default 0
bit 0 If 1 means the file contains high-resolution CT contone information bit 1 If 1 means the file contains line-art (line-work) information bit 2 If 1 means the file contains trapping information

rule.title: HCUsage valid Type
rule.description: HCUsage Tag type must be LONG
rule.assert: HCUsage type is not valid, an LONG type is expected

rule.title: HCUsage valid cardinality
rule.description: The cardinality of the HCUsage tag must be 1

rule.title: HCUsage valid only in HC file
rule.description: HCUsage should only be used in TIFF/IT-HC files
rule.assert: HCUsage should only be used in TIFF/IT-HC files

rule.title: HCUsage default value
rule.description: HCUsage has a default value. if it not present default value 0 is assumed
rule.assert: HCUsage has a default value. if it not present default value 0 is assumed

rules.title: TrapIndicator
rules.description:
The TrapIndicator field is optional and is used to indicate whether the file or file set has been trapped. Trapped means the modification of the boundaries of colour objects to prevent the media colour from accidentally showing through when colour planes are slightly misregistered in the reproduction process.
Tag = 34031 (84EF.H) Type = BYTE N = 1 Default 1
valid values are: 1 = file set includes any necessary trapping data and no further trapping is needed 0 = no trapping modifications have been made to the file or file set. Any desired trapping must be done before final rendering.
The value of TrapIndicator, if present, shall be “1” for SD files. In file types other than FP, the TrapIndicator indicates the presence of trapping internal to that single file. In an FP file set, the value of TrapIndicator indicates the status of trapping both within and between all subfiles. The value in the FP file shall be used and the value in the individual files shall be ignored.

rule.title: TrapIndicator valid Type
rule.description: TrapIndicator Tag type must be BYTE
rule.assert: TrapIndicator type is not valid, an BYTE type is expected

rule.title: TrapIndicator valid cardinality
rule.description: The cardinality of the TrapIndicator tag must be 1

rule.title: TrapIndicator default value
rule.description: TrapIndicator has a default value. if it not present default value 1 is assumed
rule.assert: TrapIndicator has a default value. if it not present default value 1 is assumed

rules.title: PhotometricInterpretation
rules.description:
The color space of the image data.
Tag = 262 (106.H) Type = SHORT N = 1 No default
Currently defined values are: 0 = BackgroundColor. Recommended for MP, BP, and BL images 1 = ImageColor (foreground colour). for MP, BP, and BL images 2 = RGB. In the RGB model, a color is described as a combination of the three primary colors of light (red, green, and blue) in particular concentrations. 5 = CMYK. (The primary colour space for TIFF/IT Standard) for CT, LW, SD, and HC images, file data in the sequence CMYK, or separated image file data in other colours or sequences if modified by other fields. 6 = YCbCr. 8 = CIE L*a*b*.
There is no default for PhotometricInterpretation, and it is required. Do not rely on applications defaulting to what you want.

rule.title: Valid Photometric Interpretation value
rule.description:
The Photometric Interpretation tag must have a valid value.
0 = WhiteIsZero. For bilevel and grayscale images: 0 is imaged as white. 1 = BlackIsZero. For bilevel and grayscale images: 0 is imaged as black. 2 = RGB. RGB value of (0,0,0) represents black, and (255,255,255) represents white, assuming 8-bit components. The components are stored in the indicated order: first Red, then Green, then Blue. 3 = Palette color. In this model, a color is described with a single component. The value of the component is used as an index into the red, green and blue curves in the ColorMap field to retrieve an RGB triplet that defines the color. When PhotometricInterpretation=3 is used, ColorMap must be present and SamplesPerPixel must be 1. 4 = Transparency Mask. This means that the image is used to define an irregularly shaped region of another image in the same TIFF file. SamplesPerPixel and BitsPerSample must be 1. PackBits compression is recommended. The 1-bits define the interior of the region; the 0-bits define the exterior of the region. 5 = CMYK.The primary colour space for TIFF/IT Standard.
rule.assert: Photometric Interpretation value must be between 0 and 4

rules.title: ColorSequence
rules.description:
This field specified optional colours or colour sequences
Tag = 34017 (84E1.H) Type = ASCII No default

rule.title: ColorSequence tag valid Type
rule.description: ColorSequence Tag type must be ASCII
rule.assert: ColorSequence Tag type is not valid, an ASCII type is expected

rule.title: ColorSequence tag valid Cardinality
rule.description: The total number of unique entries in ColorSequence is limited to sixteen (16).
rule.assert: The total number of unique entries in ColorSequence is limited to sixteen

rules.title: InkSet
rules.description:
The set of inks used in a separated (PhotometricInterpretation=5) image.
Tag = 332 (14C.H) Type = SHORT N = 1 Default is 1
Current values are: 1 = CMYK. The order of the components is cyan, magenta, yellow, black. Usually, a value of 0 represents 0% ink coverage and a value of 255 represents 100% ink coverage for that component, but see DotRange below. The InkNames field should not exist when InkSet=1. 2 = not CMYK. See the InkNames field for a description of the inks to be used.

rule.title: InkSet tag valid Type
rule.description: InkSet Tag type must be SHORT
rule.assert: InkSet Tag type is not valid, a SHORT type is expected

rule.title: InkSet valid cardinality
rule.description: The cardinality of the InkSet tag must be 1
rule.assert: InkSet cardinality is not valid, cardinality should be 1

rule.title: InkSet only in CMYK Image IFD
rule.description: InkSet should only be used in a Image File Directory containing a CMYK image
rule.assert: InkSet tag should only be used in a Image File Directory containing a CMYK image

rule.title: InkSet no CMYK need InkNames
rule.description: The InkNames field must exist when InkSet=2 (No CMYK image)
rule.assert: InkNames field must exist when InkSet=2

rule.title: InkSet default value
rule.description: When Inkset is not defined in a CMYK image then the default value 1 (CMYK) is assumed
rule.assert: InkSet not defined the default value 1(CMYK) is assumed

rules.title: NumberOfInks
rules.description:
The number of inks. Usually equal to SamplesPerPixel, unless there are extra samples.
Tag = 334 (14E.H) Type = SHORT N = 1 Default is 4

rule.title: NumberOfInks tag valid Type
rule.description: NumberOfInks Tag type must be LONG
rule.assert: NumberOfInks Tag type is not valid, a LONG type is expected

rule.title: NumberOfInks valid cardinality
rule.description: The cardinality of the NumberOfInks tag must be 1
rule.assert: NumberOfInks cardinality is not valid, cardinality should be 1

rule.title: NumberOfInks only in CMYK Image IFD
rule.description: NumberOfInks should only be used in a Image File Directory containing a CMYK image
rule.assert: NumberOfInks tag should only be used in a Image File Directory containing a CMYK image

rule.title: NumberOfInks default value
rule.description: When NumberOfInks is not defined in a CMYK image then the default value 4 is assumed
rule.assert: NumberOfInks not defined the default value 4 is assumed

rule.title: NumberOfInks match SamplesPerPixel
rule.description: Unless ExtraSamples are used NumberOfInks must match SamplesPerPixel
rule.assert: Unless ExtraSamples are used NumberOfInks must match SamplesPerPixel

rules.title: InkNames
rules.description:
The name of each ink used in a separated (PhotometricInterpretation=5) image, written as a list of concatenated, NUL-terminated ASCII strings. The number of strings must be equal to NumberOfInks. The samples are in the same order as the ink names.
Tag = 333 (14D.H) Type = ASCII N = total number of characters in all the ink name strings, including the NULs. No default

rule.title: InkNames tag valid Type
rule.description: InkNames Tag type must be ASCII
rule.assert: InkNames Tag type is not valid, an ASCII type is expected

rule.title: InkNames valid cardinality
rule.description: The cardinality InkNames Tag type must be equal of NumberOfInks
rule.assert: InkNames invalid cardinality, InkNames Tag type must be equal of NumberOfInks

rule.title: InkNames only in CMYK Image IFD
rule.description: InkNames should only be used in a Image File Directory containing a CMYK image
rule.assert: InkNames tag should only be used in a Image File Directory containing a CMYK image

rules.title: CMYKEquivalent
rules.description:
CMYKEquivalent is the set of entries for the cyan, magenta, yellow and black inks that together define a colour that is expected to be as close as possible visually to 100 % of the specified ink.
Tag = 34032 (84F0.H) Type = BYTE or SHORT N= Any

rule.title: CMYKEquivalent tag valid Type
rule.description: CMYKEquivalent Tag type must be BYTE or SHORT
rule.assert: CMYKEquivalent Tag type is not valid, a BYTE or SHORT type is expected

rule.title: CMYKEquivalent only in CMYK Image IFD
rule.description: CMYKEquivalent should only be used in a Image File Directory containing a CMYK image
rule.assert: CMYKEquivalent tag should only be used in a Image File Directory containing a CMYK image

rules.title: DotRange
rules.description:
The component values that correspond to a 0% dot and 100% dot. DotRange[0] corresponds to a 0% dot, and DotRange[1] corresponds to a 100% dot. If a DotRange pair is included for each component, the values for each component are stored together, so that the pair for Cyan would be first, followed by the pair for Magenta, and so on. Use of multiple dot ranges is, however, strongly discouraged in the interests of simplicity and compatibility with ANSI IT8 standards. A number of prepress systems like to keep some “headroom” and “footroom” on both ends of the range. What to do with components that are less than the 0% aim point or greater than the 100% aim point is not specified and is application-dependent.
It is strongly recommended that a CMYK TIFF writer not attempt to use this field to reverse the sense of the pixel values so that smaller values mean more ink instead of less ink. That is, DotRange[0] should be less than DotRange[1]. DotRange[0] and DotRange[1] must be within the range [0, (2**BitsPerSample) - 1].
Tag = 336 (150.H) Type = BYTE or SHORT N = 2 Default: a component value of 0 corresponds to a 0% dot, and a component value of 255 (assuming 8-bit pixels) corresponds to a 100% dot. That is, DotRange[0] = 0 and DotRange[1] = (2**BitsPerSample) - 1.

rule.title: DotRange tag valid Type
rule.description: DotRange Tag type must be BYTE or SHORT
rule.assert: DotRange Tag type is not valid, a BYTE or SHORT type is expected

rule.title: DotRange valid cardinality
rule.description: The cardinality DotRange Tag type must be 2
rule.assert: DotRange invalid cardinality, DotRange Tag cardinality must be equal 2

rule.title: DotRange used to revers pixel values
rule.description: It is strongly discouraged that a CMYK TIFF writer attempt to use this field to reverse the sense of the pixel values so that smaller values mean more ink instead of less ink. That is, DotRange[0] should be less than DotRange[1].
rule.assert: InkNames used to reverse the sense of the pixel, That is strongly discouraged

rule.title: DotRange only in CMYK Image IFD
rule.description: DotRange should only be used in a Image File Directory containing a CMYK image
rule.assert: DotRange tag should only be used in a Image File Directory containing a CMYK image

rules.title: ColorCharacterization
rules.description:
The colour values of separated, RGB or other colour images may be further characterized by the use of data tables as specified in ISO 12641 and ISO 12642, or a named colour space, such as “sRBG” as defined in IEC 61966-2-1. These ASCII data tables may be carried with the image file they describe by use of the ColorCharacterization field.
Tag = 34029 (84ED.H) Type = ASCII No default

rule.title: ColorCharacterization tag valid Type
rule.description: ColorCharacterization Tag type must be ASCII
rule.assert: ColorCharacterization Tag type is not valid, an ASCII type is expected

rules.title: InterColourProfile
rules.description:
This tag encodes an embedded InterColour device profile relating to the camera colour characterization. Refer to "ICC.1:2001, File Format for Colour Profiles", for further information on the use of this tag. Note that the ICC Profile Format may be revised in the future and the most recent version of the ICC specification should be used.
Tag = 34675 (8773.H) Type = UNDEFINED N = any (actual size of the embedded IC profile in bytes)

rule.title: InterColourProfile tag valid Type
rule.description: InterColourProfile Tag type must be UNDEFINED

reference.section: Section 5.2: TIFF/EP tag definitions grouped by function

rule.assert: InterColourProfile Tag type is not valid, an UNDEFINED type is expected

rule.title: InterColourProfile valid cardinality
rule.description: The cardinality of the InterColourProfile tag must be 1

reference.section: Section 5.2: TIFF/EP tag definitions grouped by function

rule.assert: InterColourProfile cardinality is not valid, cardinality should be 1

rules.title: ColorTable
rules.description:
In LW images, colour values are specified by encoding them in a colour palette table.
Tag = 34675 (8773.H) Type = BYTE N = (Last Valid Colour + 1)*20

rule.title: ColorTable tag valid Type
rule.description: ColorTable Tag type must be BYTE

reference.section: Section 5.2: TIFF/EP tag definitions grouped by function

rule.assert: ColorTable Tag type is not valid, an BYTE type is expected

rule.title: ColorTable valid cardinality
rule.description: The cardinality of the ColorTable tag must be (LastValidColour + 1)*20

reference.section: Section 5.2: TIFF/EP tag definitions grouped by function

rule.assert: ColorTable cardinality is not valid, cardinality should be (LastValidColour + 1)*20

rule.title: ColorTable valid only in LW file
rule.description: ColorTable should only be used in TIFF/IT-LW files
rule.assert: ColorTable should only be used in TIFF/IT-LW files

rules.title: ImageColorValue
rules.description:
This field denote the value of the image color in BP and BL images
Tag = 34025 (84E9.H) Type = BYTE N = 1

rule.title: ImageColorValue tag valid Type
rule.description: ImageColorValue Tag type must be BYTE

reference.section: Section 5.2: TIFF/EP tag definitions grouped by function

rule.assert: ImageColorValue Tag type is not valid, an BYTE type is expected

rule.title: ImageColorValue valid cardinality
rule.description: The cardinality of the ImageColorValue tag must be 1

reference.section: Section 5.2: TIFF/EP tag definitions grouped by function

rule.assert: ImageColorValue cardinality is not valid, cardinality should be 1

rule.title: ImageColorValue valid only in BP and BL files
rule.description: ImageColorValue should only be used in TIFF/IT-BP and TIFF/IT-BL files
rule.assert: ImageColorValue should only be used in TIFF/IT-BP and TIFF/IT-BL files

rules.title: BackgroundColorValue
rules.description:
This field denote the value of the image background in BP and BL images
Tag = 34026 (84EA.H) Type = BYTE N = 1

rule.title: BackgroundColorValue tag valid Type
rule.description: BackgroundColorValue Tag type must be BYTE

reference.section: Section 5.2: TIFF/EP tag definitions grouped by function

rule.assert: BackgroundColorValue Tag type is not valid, an BYTE type is expected

rule.title: BackgroundColorValue valid cardinality
rule.description: The cardinality of the BackgroundColorValue tag must be 1

reference.section: Section 5.2: TIFF/EP tag definitions grouped by function

rule.assert: BackgroundColorValue cardinality is not valid, cardinality should be 1

rule.title: BackgroundColorValue valid only in BP and BL files
rule.description: BackgroundColorValue should only be used in TIFF/IT-BP and TIFF/IT-BL files
rule.assert: BackgroundColorValue should only be used in TIFF/IT-BP and TIFF/IT-BL files

rules.title: PixelIntensityRange
rules.description:
The pixels in an MP image denote intensities of a particular colour. The colour is defined by the ImageColorValue field. Similar to the DotRange field, percent intensity may be mapped into two-byte values as indicated by the field PixelIntensityRange
Tag = 34027 (84EB.H) Type = BYTE N = 2 Default values : 0,(2**BitsPerSample−1)

rule.title: PixelIntensityRange tag valid Type
rule.description: PixelIntensityRange Tag type must be BYTE

reference.section: Section 5.2: TIFF/EP tag definitions grouped by function

rule.assert: PixelIntensityRange Tag type is not valid, an BYTE type is expected

rule.title: PixelIntensityRange valid cardinality
rule.description: The cardinality of the PixelIntensityRange tag must be 2

reference.section: Section 5.2: TIFF/EP tag definitions grouped by function

rule.assert: PixelIntensityRange cardinality is not valid, cardinality should be 2

rule.title: PixelIntensityRange default value
rule.description: PixelIntensityRange has a default value. if it not present default value 0,(2**BitsPerSample−1) is assumed
rule.assert: PixelIntensityRange has a default value. if it not present default value 0,(2**BitsPerSample−1) is assumed

rule.title: PixelIntensityRange valid only in MP files
rule.description: PixelIntensityRange should only be used in TIFF/IT-MP files
rule.assert: PixelIntensityRange should only be used in TIFF/IT-MP files

rules.title: TransparencyIndicator
rules.description:
TransparencyIndicator is used as a transparency indicator for HC files.
Tag = 34028 (84EC.H) Type = BYTE N = 1 Default 0
valid values are: 0 = signifies that transparency is not used 1 = transparency is used

rule.title: TransparencyIndicator tag valid Type
rule.description: TransparencyIndicator Tag type must be BYTE

reference.section: Section 5.2: TIFF/EP tag definitions grouped by function

rule.assert: TransparencyIndicator Tag type is not valid, an BYTE type is expected

rule.title: TransparencyIndicator valid cardinality
rule.description: The cardinality of the TransparencyIndicator tag must be 1

reference.section: Section 5.2: TIFF/EP tag definitions grouped by function

rule.assert: TransparencyIndicator cardinality is not valid, cardinality should be 1

rule.title: TransparencyIndicator valid values
rule.description: The only valid values for TransparencyIndicator are: 0 = signifies that transparency is not used 1 = signifies that transparency is used

reference.section: Section 5.2: TIFF/EP tag definitions grouped by function

rule.assert: TransparencyIndicator value is not valid, the only valid values are 0 and 1

rule.title: TransparencyIndicator default value
rule.description: TransparencyIndicator has a default value. if it not present default value 0, no transparency, is assumed
rule.assert: TransparencyIndicator has a default value. if it not present default value 0 is assumed

rule.title: TransparencyIndicator valid only in HC files
rule.description: TransparencyIndicator should only be used in TIFF/IT-HC files
rule.assert: TransparencyIndicator should only be used in TIFF/IT-HC files

rules.title: ImageColorIndicator
rules.description:
The data stream for binary images (BP and BL) functions as a switch between foreground and background colours. The ImageColorIndicator field indicates whether or not the particular image or foreground colour is encoded in the binary image (along with information about transparency) or in the monochrome continuoustone picture image (where no background colour exists)
Tag = 34023 (84E7.H) Type = BYTE N = 1 Default 0
Valid values are:
0 = image/background colour not defined (default value); 1 = image/background colour defined; 2 = full transparency, image/background colour not defined.

rule.title: ImageColorIndicator tag valid Type
rule.description: ImageColorIndicator Tag type must be BYTE

reference.section: Section 5.2: TIFF/EP tag definitions grouped by function

rule.assert: ImageColorIndicator Tag type is not valid, an BYTE type is expected

rule.title: ImageColorIndicator valid cardinality
rule.description: The cardinality of the ImageColorIndicator tag must be 1

reference.section: Section 5.2: TIFF/EP tag definitions grouped by function

rule.assert: ImageColorIndicator cardinality is not valid, cardinality should be 1

rule.title: ImageColorIndicator valid values

reference.section: Section 5.2: TIFF/EP tag definitions grouped by function

rule.assert: ImageColorIndicator value is not valid, the only valid values are 0 and 1

rule.title: ImageColorIndicator default value in TIFF/IT-BP
rule.description: ImageColorIndicator has a default value. if it not present default value 0, image/background colour not defined, is assumed
rule.assert: ImageColorIndicator has a default value. if it not present default value 0 is assumed

rule.title: ImageColorIndicator default value in TIFF/IT-BL
rule.description: ImageColorIndicator has a default value. if it not present default value 0, image/background colour not defined, is assumed
rule.assert: ImageColorIndicator has a default value. if it not present default value 0 is assumed

rule.title: ImageColorIndicator default value in TIFF/IT-MP
rule.description: ImageColorIndicator has a default value. if it not present default value 0, image/background colour not defined, is assumed
rule.assert: ImageColorIndicator has a default value. if it not present default value 0 is assumed

rule.title: ImageColorIndicator valid only in HC files
rule.description: ImageColorIndicator should only be used in TIFF/IT-HC files
rule.assert: ImageColorIndicator should only be used in TIFF/IT-HC files

rule.title: ImageColorIndicator valid only in HC files
rule.description: ImageColorIndicator should only be used in TIFF/IT-HC files
rule.assert: ImageColorIndicator should only be used in TIFF/IT-HC files
YCbCr shall be used only when compression has the value 7
